meanings.definition: Situated or occurring at or near the margin or edge.
meanings.sent1: The intermarginal flowers added a delicate touch to the garden's border.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully painted the intermarginal details of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The intermarginal butterflies danced along the edge of the meadow.
meanings.sent4: Her intermarginal presence on the stage captured everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The intermarginal waves gently lapped at the shore, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or situated at the boundary or edge.
meanings.sent1: The intermarginal fence marked the boundary of the property.
meanings.sent2: The hikers followed the intermarginal trail along the edge of the forest.
meanings.sent3: The intermarginal shadows cast by the trees created a mysterious atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her intermarginal position in the company gave her a unique perspective.
meanings.sent5: The intermarginal clouds on the horizon signaled an approaching storm.

meanings.definition: Lying at or near the margin or edge.
meanings.sent1: The intermarginal rocks along the shore provided a habitat for small creatures.
meanings.sent2: The intermarginal seats at the theater offered a great view of the stage.
meanings.sent3: The intermarginal flowers peeked out from the edge of the garden.
meanings.sent4: His intermarginal notes in the book highlighted important details.
meanings.sent5: The intermarginal branches of the tree swayed in the breeze.
